frame.name: Appellations
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame is only for words that are used as the <fen>Title</fen>s of individuals. The <fen>Title</fen> is applied to a <fen>Name</fen> (surname or full name) and often designates their rank within a man-made institution (e.g. chief, king, bishop, brother) or general social status (mr., miss), or may indicate a kinship relationship (cousin, aunt). Pairings of Title and Name can be used as vocatives (see Attention_getting), while the Titles may not always be vocative on their own.
<ex>He saluted <fex name="Title"><t>General</t></fex> <fex name="Name">Fightmeister</fex> walking into the room.</ex> <ex>Everyone stood as <fex name="Title"><t>Captain</t></fex> <fex name="Name">Jack Aubrey</fex> delivered a toast.</ex> <ex><fex name="Context">Supreme Court</fex> <fex name="Type">Chief</fex> <t><fex name="Title">Justice</fex></t> <fex name="Name">John Roberts</fex> is sticking to his guns .</ex> <ex><t><fex name="Title">Captain</fex></t> <fex name="Name">Mike Eruzione</fex> <fex name="Con">of the USA Miracle on Ice hockey team in 1980</fex> turns 58 today.</ex>
Most LUs of this frame are related to LUs of the Leadership or Kinship frames, but some (e.g. Lady, Mr., Brother) occur only here. These LUs differ from normal examples of LUs in Leadership or Kinship in that the LUs are used simply as vocatives or as modifiers of names, to indicate how the individual fits into the general or specific social context.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>The name of the person referred to by a <fen>Title</fen>.
<ex><t>Reverend</t> <fex name="Name">Roberts</fex> wears wrinkled robes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Title
FE.definition:
<def-root>How a person is referred to within an Institution, often denoting their rank or status. Title is always marked on the target.
<ex><fex name="Title"><t>Judge</t></fex> Judy has made her decision.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Context
FE.definition:
<def-root>The language, region, or domain in which the <fen>Title</fen> applies.
<ex><t>Judge</t> Noonan <fex name="Con">of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit</fex> will cast his vote today.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>The sub-type of the <fen>Title</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Type">High</fex> <t>King</t> Brian shook his head sadly .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: officer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: person who holds a position of authority or responsibility in the army, navy, air force, government, or a corporation, or who is a member of a police department

lexUnit.name: general.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a commissioned officer of the military at the top of the rank structure

lexUnit.name: captain.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a licensed mariner who has the highest rank of command on a vessel

lexUnit.name: president.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an elected official with governing power over a republican state, university, or company

lexUnit.name: bishop.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a senior member of the Christian clergy, usually in charge of a diocese and empowered to confer holy orders

lexUnit.name: chairman.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person in charge of a meeting, committee, company, or other organization

lexUnit.name: chairperson.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a chairman or chairwoman (used as a neutral alternative)

lexUnit.name: chief.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the head of an organization

lexUnit.name: commander.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person in authority, especially in a military context

lexUnit.name: commissioner.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the head of a public organization

lexUnit.name: congressman.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a male official who is a member of congress, and especially of the US House of Representatives

lexUnit.name: congresswoman.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a female official who is a member of congress, and especially of the US House of Representatives

lexUnit.name: director.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: person who is in charge of an activity, department, or organization

lexUnit.name: duchess.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the wife/widow of a duke, or a woman holding a rank equivalent to duke

lexUnit.name: emperor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the ruler of an empire

lexUnit.name: empress.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the female ruler of an empire, or the wife/widow of an emperor

lexUnit.name: executive.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the head of a business, law, or government agency

lexUnit.name: governor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: head of a public institution or a state, district, etc.

lexUnit.name: headmaster.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: chiefly Brit. a male head teacher

lexUnit.name: imam.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the person who leads prayers in a mosque

lexUnit.name: kaiser.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the German Emperor, the Emperor of Austria, or the head of the Holy Roman Empire

lexUnit.name: king.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the male ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth

lexUnit.name: leader.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the person who leads, commands, or precedes a group, organization, or country

lexUnit.name: legislator.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an elected official working in the legislature; one who makes the laws

lexUnit.name: maharaja.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: historical. an Indian prince

lexUnit.name: mayor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the elected head of the municipal corporation of a city or borough

lexUnit.name: minister.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a head of an administrative government department

lexUnit.name: mogul.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a powerful head of a major company, especially with respect to a particular industry

lexUnit.name: monarch.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a sovereign head of state, especially a king, queen, or emperor

lexUnit.name: official.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person holding public office or having official duties

lexUnit.name: premier.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a Prime Minister or other head of government

lexUnit.name: prince.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: in terms of a monarchical government, the royal heir to kingship

lexUnit.name: principal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the head or senior person in an organization or group, especially a school or college

lexUnit.name: queen.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth

lexUnit.name: representative.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a politician that represents a constituent in a democratic government

lexUnit.name: secretary.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the person in charge of a subsection of the government, i.e. the Secretary of Defense

lexUnit.name: shah.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: formerly, a title of the monarch of Iran

lexUnit.name: sheik.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an Arab leader, especially the chief or head of a tribe, family, or village

lexUnit.name: sultan.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a Muslim sovereign

lexUnit.name: superintendent.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who oversees or directs some work, enterprise, district or institution

lexUnit.name: supervisor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: person in charge of a limited jurisdiction, often a county or city

lexUnit.name: tsar.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an emperor of Russia before 1917

lexUnit.name: mother.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the superior of a religious community of women

lexUnit.name: father.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a priest (used especially as a title)

lexUnit.name: doctor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who is qualified to practice medicine

lexUnit.name: dr.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: abbreviation for doctor

lexUnit.name: mr.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: abbreviation for mister; a respectful title that precedes a man's name or position

lexUnit.name: mrs.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: originally an abbreviation for mistress; a respectful title that precedes the name of a married woman

lexUnit.name: ms.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a respectful title that precedes a woman's name or position (and which does not indicate marital status)

lexUnit.name: miss.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a respectful title that precedes the name of a unmarried woman

lexUnit.name: child.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a son or daughter of any age

lexUnit.name: aunt.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the sister of one's father or mother or the wife of one's uncle

lexUnit.name: uncle.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the brother of one's father or mother or the husband of one's aunt

lexUnit.name: sister.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a female member of a religious community that observes vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience

lexUnit.name: brother.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a male member of a religious organization that has a priesthood

lexUnit.name: cousin.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a child of one's uncle or aunt
